id.description:
Unique identifier of the asset.


Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

author.description: Unique identifier of the user who created this record

provider.description: Legal entity who provides the asset (owner). It is the affiliation of the author by default.

build.description: Build number, incremented automatically to provide versioning for the asset

name.description: a human-readable name to ease identification and discoverability for human users

description.description: a short, human-readable description of the Algorithm to aid a human user in analysing the Algorithm’s capabilities and its applicability to a certain problem

classification_schema.description: the classification of the Algorithm, to describe the specialization area

type.description: a detailed list of attributes to describe the Algorithm’s field of application

version.description: the version, as defined by the provider

list_of_microservices.description: a list of Microservice Asset IDs, which are contained in the algorithm

deployment_mapping.description: a mapping specifying which microservice should run on which host. By default each microservice is assigned a respective host, but this behaviour is not always ideal (eg. when two or more Microservices may need to run on the same host)

id.description:
Unique identifier of the asset.


Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

author.description: Unique identifier of the user who created this record

provider.description: Legal entity who provides the asset (owner). It is the affiliation of the author by default.

build.description: Build number, incremented automatically to provide versioning for the asset

version.description: Version of the data resource (not of the metadata), defined by the provider in the format of his/her choice (typically: major.minor.patch)

description.description: Human readable description of the data resource characteristics, contents.

description_url.description: More detailed specification of data source characteristics (doc, pdf, …)

size.description: Estimated/exact size of data (e.g. file size, volume size, or message size); might be used to assess HW requirements (RAM, CPU). In bytes.

tags.description: A list of tags freely added to help in searching/indexing (not limited to a basic set of tags, keywords)

kind.description: Main category of the data resource (e.g. file/object storage, database management system, streaming broker). FILE can mean a single file or a folder.

direction.description: Direction of data flow (source: data provider, sink: data consumer/storage)

format.description: Format/encoding of the data produced or consumed by the data resource as a MIME type (IETF RFC 6838 https://www.sitepoint.com/mime-types-complete-list/). More than one can appear here (remote directory with several files).

type.description: The exact type of the data resource. Typically (but not always) corresponds to the scheme part (scheme://) of URI. E.g.: mysql, mqtt.

uri.description: Accessibility of the data resource, including host, port information, protocol, and other fields (path is protocol dependent, can be a topic name). GUI may show host, port, path separately. Hidden at search. Format: scheme://host:port/path.  Pseudo vars: SCHEME, HOST, PORT, PATH, QUERY, FRAGMENT.

auth_type.description: One or more authentication types that can be accepted by the storage resource.

credentials.description: Credentials (e.g. string/json, zip, config file). Its content (structure) depends on authentication type (e.g. token, username and password). OPEN means must not be filled here, but asked from user on startup.

aux_info.description: List of key-value pais (JSON object/YAML dictionary) for additional specification of the data resource. New keys can be added on demand, a list of known keys is available.

schema.description: Describes message internal structure, semantics, ontology. It can be any file (doc, rdf, owl, etc.). Asset Administration Shell, IEC 61360 - Common Data Dictionary, ...

schema_url.description: URL to schema specification document (in some format, rdf, owl, xsd, …)

id.description:
Unique identifier for the IP Fam.


Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

version.description: Version number of the IP Family

author.description: Identifier of the Author of the IP Family

manager.description: Identifier of the Legal Entity managing the IP Family

name.description: Technical Name of the IP Family

model_no.description: Number defined by the IP Man.

ip_man.description: Identifier of the IP Manufacturer (Legal Entity)

id.description:
Unique identifier for the IP Inst.


Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

version.description: Version number of the IP Instance

author.description: Identifier of the Author of the IP Instance

operator.description: Identifier of the Legal Entity operating the IP Instance

serial_no.description: Number defined by the IP Man.

location.description: Physical location of the IP Instance

id.description:
Unique identifier of the asset.


Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

author.description: Unique identifier of the user who created this record

provider.description: Legal entity who provides the asset (owner). It is the affiliation of the author by default.

build.description: Build number, incremented automatically to provide versioning for the asset

version.description: Version number of the MA Pair, defined by the provider

licensor.description: Identifier of the Legal Entity licensing the MA Pair (NB: Entity for Licensor is referenced)

derivation.description: In case of derivation, references to parent / child (optional)

name.description: Short name to identify the MA Pair

scope.description: Short description of the scope of the MA Pair (human readable)

ip_family.description: Identifier of the IP Family the MA Pair is valid for

namespace.description: Context to interpret the associated information (optional?)

m_asset.description:
Identifier of the Model Asset associated to the MA Pair (NB: The corresponding model file is indicated in Model metadata (first tab) as Model_URI and the corresponding zip file needs to be served to the Algorithm to evaluate the Model by the Microservice (MODEL_FILENAME))


Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `microservice.id`.<fk table='microservice' column='id'/>

a_asset.description:
Identifiers of the Algorithm Asset associated to the MA Pair


Note:
This is a Foreign Key to `algorithm.id`.<fk table='algorithm' column='id'/>

rules.description: References to recommended Rules to be verified per Evaluation of the MA Pair

frequency.description: Recommended number of evaluations conducted per hour for the MA Pair (optional)

payload.description: User-defined key-value pairs: JSON string with additional information (optional)

id.description:
Unique identifier of the asset.

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

author.description: Unique identifier of the user who created this record.

provider.description: Legal entity who provides the asset (owner). It is the affiliation of the author by default.

build.description: Build number, incremented automatically to provide versioning for the asset.

name.description: human readable short, yet descriptive name of the Microservice.

version.description: version as defined by the user.

description.description: human readable short description of the Microservice's capabilities.

type.description: detailed type of the microservice, list of keywords

deployment_format.description: identifier of the deployment environment required to deploy the Microservice's container

deployment_data.description: JSON of docker-compose or kubernetes manifest required to run the container

configuration_data.description: List of objects specifying configuration file(s) content required by the service

mounted_shared_directories.description: A note for developers of co-operating Microservices. Directories that should be shared to the host where this microservice can find required inputs / store outputs

recommended_gpu_ram.description: recommended amount of GPU memory in GB

gpu_type.description: a description of the type of GPUs, and further specifications, to allow the execution of the Microservice

hpc_required.description: whether this Microservice requires an HPC environment to be executed efficiently

edge_type.description: required type of edge device to allow the execution of the Microservice

recommended_ram.description: recommended amount of memory in GB

required_disk_space.description: required amount of disk space in GB

os_arch.description: supported os architecture. Defaults to x86

os_type.description: supported os type. Defaults to Linux

data_resource.description: list of Data objects for each required data resource, specified using the "DATA" fields in the linked substructure

model_recommended_auth_tools.description: list of recommended AuthoringTools used to generate the Model

parameters.description: list of Parameter objects for each possible parameters, to be specified before deployment

metrics.description: list of Metric objects for each metric collected by the Microservice

id.description:
Unique identifier of the asset.


Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

author.description: Unique identifier of the user who created this record

provider.description: Legal entity who provides the asset (owner). It is the affiliation of the author by default.

build.description: Build number, incremented automatically to provide versioning for the asset

version.description: Version of the model, defined by the provider.

license.description: License of the model.  Type tbd in SAD group

provider_contacts.description: Dictionary with keys being phone, email, address - Type takes into account co-simulation models, for which solver info is mandatory (next slide)

marketplace_description.description: Model tag description Additional info about model files (e.g. versioning, scope, i.e. what is the model used for, e.g. simulation, control, etc.) - Human readable marketplace description

auth_tool.description: Authoring Tool used to create the model

type.description: ML, LCA, 3D FEM and CFD, System simulation, discrete event simulation, co-simulation (it couples a model with specific algorithms) - The original term Path was proposed to be changed (SAD)

repository_uri.description: Where the model file is stored (usually the DigitBrain certified external model repository). The path and model filename are not provided via this field.

path.description: Path to the model file in the specified repository, not including the filename itself.

filename.description: Name of the model file at the given path within the given repo, with a file extension if it exists.

inslots.description: List of objects with values on which the model is evaluated (or parameters that might set before or during the evaluation) - Inputs and parameters together, although if needed we can still differentiate them internally in key field for each specific model.

outslots.description: List of objects with values that the model approximates

minimum_number_of_gpu_cores.description: Minimum required number of GPU cores

minimum_cpus.description: Minimum required number of CPU cores

required_disk_space.description: Required amount of disk space in GB
